concept_data.title: African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights

summary: The "African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights" is a pivotal international treaty that enshrines fundamental rights and freedoms for individuals and peoples across Africa. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this Charter serves as a reference point for the promotion of human rights, influencing EU external relations and development policies. The Charter emphasizes the importance of collective rights, which resonates with the EU's commitment to uphold human dignity and fundamental freedoms. Its principles are often integrated into EU dialogues with African nations, fostering cooperation and adherence to shared values in human rights protection.
